comment: Weak.  Not “black” as advertised.  Much better options available.
Simple yet a good buy.  Easy over ice.  One of my go to bourbons.
Smooth with just a bit of a malty and darker flavor
Sweet and smooth, easy to sip neat
Can’t really taste the coffee hint. Lingering warmth. Good mixer if you’re not worried.

Interesting packaging first of all to say the least, comes off as a can of turpentine to the untrained eye.

Not a coffee drinker myself but you can without a doubt get the hints of tue coffee bean finish to this one. Great concept & one to keep an eye out for; this along with their other flavored whiskeys; Gluten-Free if I remember correctly. Cheers!!
Lots of coffee on the nose and body. Very smooth
Surprisingly smooth on the second sip. Slight coffee notes in the after taste
Almond vanilla at the front. Smooth through the finish.

Great marketing with the canteen look...badass appeal! The bourbon is middle of the road, though. The coffee seems to be mostly a marketing thing also, as there’s only a small, sweet coffee note at the finish. At the end of the day, I definitely enjoyed it!m
smokey with a subtle coffee taste
very smooth, blend of bourbon and rye, mellowed in coffee
not a bourbon person but its drinkable on it own and would make a great mixer with Coke
Very different, it had a definite darker hue and somewhat of a licorice taste.
Unique with coffee processing. A bit petroleum.

The bottle is incredible. The folks around you will think you are pouring gas or paint thinner. Love the packaging. This has a a creamy tasty, quick sharp bite, and short warmth to finish. It is not the most flavorful spirit but does have quite the attractive packaging. Fun to have on the shelf. Less fun to drink.

I think this one punches way above its weight.  My wife picked this up and I was like - seriously?  Out of a can?  But I guess its a lesson that good bourbons can come from anywhere & I like this one.  I get the strong coffee taste, mixed with vanilla.  The finish is smooth & a little mild - but I get a nice transition to black liquorice/anise.  I enjoy it for the money and would buy it again.
A bit above your average run of the mill bourbon like say Wild Turkey, Jim Beam and Buffalo Trace.
Very light flavor, not impressive. Do not water down you won't be able to taste it.
